history.text: Hey, how's it going?
Hi. Good. You?
Doing well!
Have you ever seen the film The Blind Side?
I don't believe I have.
What's it about?
Oh, it's good. It's about a football player named Michael Oher who was eventually drafted into the NFL. It details his impoverished upbringing and how he became a first-round pick.
Ah, yes I have seen it. He played at Ole Miss. I remember him.
Wasn't it based on a book as well?
Sure did! Yeah, a good movie. And yes, it was based on a book of the same name by Michael Lewis.
Yeah, I enjoyed it as well. I remember it now. Had Sandra Bullock in it and Tim Mcgraw.
It's hard to believe it was based on a true story.
Yup! I love both of those actors. It also was directed by John Hancock (what a name!). But yes, a truly great story.
Oh wow. I didn't remember his mom being a drug addict. He had a tough time as a kid.
I'm a bit surprised the ratings for the movie aren't better.
Yes, he had a very rough home. He ran away from multiple homes after being in foster care. It was rough.
I also can't believe some of those ratings. Why do you think that is?
I don't know. I've seen a couple of these that didn't make sense now. I think Bullock had great performances and perhaps won awards.
Yes, her performance has been widely regarded. I think maybe some people were disappointed with some other performances in the film, but I am unsure.
Hard to believe this came out almost 10 years ago now.
I had forgotten the tension about the kids being around him in the film. He really did have a tough time.
I suspect the part about him not taking to football were embellishments. I bet he could play from the first time he stepped on the field.
So true, such a touching story. I enjoyed the depiction of Mike and his protective instincts and how he was made to be a lineman based on that.
I concur, I think he was naturally talented.
I believe he still plays. He was drafted by the Ravens.
He was fortunate to find a family that could help him. It sounds like they hired tutors and really fought for him.
Hmm, yeah, idk if he still does. He certainly made his mark on the world though, regardless of his accomplishments.
The Tuohy's certainly helped him out of a rough situation and got him into a college to play ball and took him out of an awful situation.
He came close to throwing it away by running away. He could have easily stayed in the gangs he ended up around.
They messed up threatening his family. Those protective instincts kicked in.
Yeah, so glad he didn't fall into that. His perseverance in that rough situation is what makes him special.
Do you typically watch films that are biographic? Or sports based?
Yes, I like films like this a lot. Sports Dramas pique my interest very much, and The Blind Side is a prime example why.
Me too. I'll have to check this out again. It's been a pleasure talking with you. Take care.
Same here. Great talk! Have a good one!

uid1response.feedback: It was a good movie. I had forgotten much about it though.

uid2response.feedback: The user was super active and a pleasure to talk to.
